column6: Job/Team Function
column8: Organisation

column6: The Chief Executive is responsible for the strategic leadership of NICE. NICE's role is to provide national guidance and advice to improve outcomes for people using the NHS and other public health and social care services.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column5: Deputy Chief Exec and Health and Social Care Director
column6: The Deputy Chief Executive and Health and Social Care Director, is responsible for leading the management of NICE in the absence of the Chief Executive, and has overall responsibility for the Health and Social Care Directorate. This directorate provides a range of services including the Health and Social Care Quality Programme and implementation support for NICE guidance.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column6: The Centre for Clinical Practice Director is responsible for leading the development of guidelines and quality standards on a wide range of clinical topics aimed primarily at those working in the NHS, local authorities but also of relevance to the wider public, private and voluntary sectors. The Director is also responsible for the Medicines and Prescribing Centre.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column5: Centre for Health Technology Evaluation Director
column6: The Centre for Health Technology Evaluation Director is responsible for leading the development of national guidance to the NHS on the use of new and existing medicines, treatments, medical technologies, diagnostics and procedures.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column6: The Business Planning and Resources Director is responsible for  finance, business planning,human resources, estates, corporate governance and IT services for NICE.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column5: Centre for Public Health Excellence Director
column6: The Centre for Public Health Excellence Director is responsible for leading the development of guidance on public health topics for those working in the NHS, local authorities and the wider public, private and voluntary sectors.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column6: The Communications Director is responsible for ensuring that all those with an interest in the work of NICE understand its role and responsibilities and for contributing to the core work of producing guidance through the editing, distribution and promotion processes. The Communications Director is responsible for media relations; external communications, including NICE website, events and exhibitions, public affairs and stakeholder relations; enquiry handling; internal communications; and editorial and publishing.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column6: The Evidence Resources Director is responsible for the delivery of the NICE Evidence and UK PharmaScan services and leads the information management and technology, user research and information services resources of NICE.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

column6: The Engagement and Management Programme Director is responsible for  ensuring that people are aware of the NICE Evidence Services through external communications work, and that user needs are evaluated and inform the development of the service.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column6: The Technology Appraisals Programme Director and the Patient Access Schemes Liaison Unit is responsible for leading the development of guidance on the use of new and existing medicines and treatments in the NHS, and for providing advice on the feasibility of implementing patient access schemes.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column6: The NICE International Director is responsible for providing advice to governments and other organisations outside the UK on strengthening their healthcare decision-making processes and methods.  All NICE International activities are funded by client countries or international aid agencies.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column5: Devices and Diagnostic Systems Programme Director
column6: The Devices and Diagnostic Systems Programme Director is responsible for leading the development of guidance on the use of new or existing medical technologies, interventional procedures and diagnostics in the NHS.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column5: Centre for Clinical Practice Programme Director
column6: The Centre for Clinical Practice Programme Director is responsible for leading the operational development of clinical guidance on a wide range of clinical topics.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column6: The Implementation Programme Director is responsible for providing support to key audiences and organisations, within and beyond the NHS, to maximise uptake of all types of evidence-based advice issued by NICE. The Programme works with national agencies to develop a supportive environment for implementation, provides practical support, and evaluates the uptake and impact of guidance and implementation support activities.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column6: The Chief Technology Officer Programme Director is responsible for leading on the development and maintenance of the NICE Evidence Service and for the development of new online products which increase the accessibility of NICE guidance, such as NICE Pathways.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column6: The Evidence Resources Programme Director is responsible for the development and management of the specialist resources which are accessed through the NICE Evidence Service.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column5: Medicines and Prescribing Centre Programme Director
column6: The Medicines and Prescribing Centre Programme Director is responsible for the management of the MPC which supports the NHS to improve prescribing, medicines use and patient care.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column6: The Health Technologies Adoption Programme Director is responsible for the HTAP team which supports adoption of new health technologies across the NHS
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed

column5: Health and Social Care Quality Programme Director
column6: The Health and Social Care Quality Programme Director is responsible for our work on NICE quality standards, the Quality and Outcomes Framework (QOF) and the Commissioning Group Outcome Indicator Set (CCGOIS). This team manages the social care work programme, including the development of guidance and quality standards for social care.
column8: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
column19: Salaries of staff at SCS1 or equivalent are not disclosed
